data.title: Top private schools prosper in recession
data.meta_description: Leading independent schools are prospering in the recession with demand for places up on last year, figures show today. But this may be at the expense of smaller fee-charging schools, which are much
data.text:
Leading independent schools are prospering in the recession with demand for places up on last year, figures show today.

But this may be at the expense of smaller fee-charging schools, which are much more exposed to the economic downturn.

The survey of schools belonging to the Headmasters’ and Headmistresses’ Conference(HMC), whose prestigious members include Eton, Harrow and Wellington College, found applications had increased.

Demand was up 1.7 per cent on last year among 11-year-olds, and had risen by 7.5 per cent at the age of 13 and by 8.2 per cent for sixth-form places.

owever the parents of existing pupils were not immune from the credit crunch. About 400 have been withdrawn for financial reasons in the last year.
